q: Eric Schmidt , 55, has no doubt Larry Page is ready for the challenges ahead.`` Larry Page has been with me in every major decision in the past decade,'' Eric Schmidt said in an interview Thursday. It's not like he has been sitting around doing nothing. Although management by committee worked well enough to turn Google into an enormous success, it eventually slowed Google's reaction to popular new ideas such as Facebook and Twitter. Although he tried to debunk the idea in Thursday's interview, Eric Schmidt may have been growing weary of all the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies. I don't think Eric Schmidt was pushed. I think he jumped, said Ken Auletta , author of`` Googled: The End of the World As We Know It.''`` I think Eric Schmidt is burned out.'' Don Kirshner gave new, young musicians the opportunity to showcase their performances for a huge audience during the` golden age' of the popular music business, Billy Joel said in a statement.`` At the time, his` hands-off' approach to how rock and John Roll music was presented made television a viable medium for many now-iconic recording artists.''
